tsdistance documentation¶

tsdistance is a Python library that provides multiple approaches to measure distances betwen time series. This library depends on Numpy.

  • Elastic Measures
    • General Formula
    • Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) and DTW variants
    • DTW Lower Bounds
    • Longest Common Subsequence (LCSS) and Derivative LCSS (DLCSS)
    • LCSS Lower Bounds
    • Sequence Weighted Alignment (SWALE)
    • Edit Distance with Real Penalty (ERP)
    • ERP Lower Bounds
    • Edit Distance on Real Sequences (EDR)
    • Time Warp Edit Distance (TWED)
    • TWED Lower Bound
    • Move-Split-Merge (MSM)
    • MSM Lower Bound
  • Lockstep Measures
    • Minkowski Functions
    • L1 Functions
    • Intersection Functions
    • Inner Product Functions
    • Squared Chord Functions
    • Squared L2 Functions
    • Shannon’s Enthropy Functions
    • Vicissitude Functions
    • Combination Functions
  • Sliding Measures
    • Normalized Cross-Correlation
    • Biased Normalized Cross-Correlation
    • Unbiased Normalized Cross-Correlation
    • Coefficient Normalized Cross-Correlation
  • Kernel Measures
    • Kernel Dynamic Time Warping (kdtw)
    • Shift INvariant Kernel (SINK)
    • Log Global Alignment Kernel (LGAK)
Next
